DataElement.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for intrahepatic bile duct carcinoma, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm Pathologic Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-30-19 tmt released.; 12/12/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of intrahepatic bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas (mixed hepatocholangiocarcinomas), and primary neuroendocrine tumors of the liver. Primary sarcomas of the liver, pure hepatocellular carcinomas, hilar cholangiocarcinomas, and gallbladder carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IV Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IIIB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T4, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0). T4: Tumor involving local extrahepatic structures by direct invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T4, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0). T4: Tumor involving local extrahepatic structures by direct invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IIIA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: T3, N0, M0. T3: Tumor perforating the visceral peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: T3, N0, M0. T3: Tumor perforating the visceral peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: T2, N0, M0. T2: Solitary tumor with intrahepatic vascular invasion, or multiple tumors, with or without vascular invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: T2, N0, M0. T2: Solitary tumor with intrahepatic vascular invasion, or multiple tumors, with or without vascular invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: T1b, N0, M0. T1b: Solitary tumor larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: T1b, N0, M0. T1b: Solitary tumor larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: T1a, N0, M0. T1a: Solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm without vascular invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: T1a, N0, M0. T1a: Solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm without vascular invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage 0 Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage 0 Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ (intraductal tumor). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ (intraductal tumor). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer TNM Finding v8 American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage Grouping Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of intrahepatic bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas (mixed hepatocholangiocarcinomas), and primary neuroendocrine tumors of the liver. Primary sarcomas of the liver, pure hepatocellular carcinomas, hilar cholangiocarcinomas, and gallbladder carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of intrahepatic bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas (mixed hepatocholangiocarcinomas), and primary neuroendocrine tumors of the liver. Primary sarcomas of the liver, pure hepatocellular carcinomas, hilar cholangiocarcinomas, and gallbladder carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
